title: Data Analyst
description: We are always seeking talented, motivated, growth-minded, and creative individuals. Our firm is committed to providing employee support and advancement, while embracing inclusion and innovation as keys to a stronger future.<p><br></p>We invite you to explore the position below and to submit your application to join our team!<p><br></p>Troutman Pepper has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst supporting the Data Science &amp; Analytics team. The ideal candidate has robust experience producing well-designed Power BI dashboards that provide actionable insights and highlight opportunities for non-technical users.<p><br></p>The position works with key stakeholders across the organization to design, develop, and deploy analytical tools and dashboards that enhance decision making, drive automation and efficiencies, improve the client experience, and identify areas where we can further support our client needs.<p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Using Power BI, visualize information to extract trends and translate data into actionable insights and analytics with the end-users’ goals in mind.</li><li>Working with team members, extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from disparate sources and unify where possible; manipulate, clean, and prepare data for analysis on an ongoing, project-by-project basis.</li><li>Support the Senior Data Scientist with ETL and other projects on an as-needed basis</li><li>Assist in project management by coordinating and documenting requirements gathering efforts, end-user feedback, and usage of visualization solutions available across the firm.</li><li>Collaborate with lawyers and stakeholders across business services, building relationships and identifying opportunities to leverage analytics and dashboards to enhance firm strategies and operations.</li><li>Act as product manager for dashboards, reports, and other deliverables, ensuring that feedback from all stakeholders is gathered and leveraged in the ongoing system enhancement process.</li><li>Where appropriate, assist in the management of outside vendors which support external data reporting and APIs, including outside consultants, product support personnel, trainers and others as requested.</li><li>Work with members of other teams, including the IT organization, to resolve technical problems that may arise across data sources and teams.</li><li>Gather input to facilitate the implementation of data-based solutions across the organization.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Intellectually curious, a creative, self-starter with innovative problem-solving skills who can handle multiple projects simultaneously while focusing on continuous improvement.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills required to present results of analysis to audiences of all levels, including firm leadership and attorneys.</li><li>Strong analytical skills with proven experience interpreting business needs and drawing insights from raw data.</li><li>Proactive, self-motivated, willing to learn new skills, and strives for continuous improvement.</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and with teams to promote consistent and efficient workflow processes.</li><li>Identify and respond to internal and external client inquiries in a timely manner and seek feedback/follow-up as appropriate.</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to provide high-quality service and partner effectively with diverse groups of people at various levels within the firm as well as external contacts.</li><li>Ability to self-manage and work independently in a hybrid, and in-office setting.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High degree of proficiency in data visualization platforms (Power BI preferred) and data management platforms (e.g., Alteryx, SQL Server Mgmt. Studio, Azure Data Studio).</li><li>Advanced knowledge and experience with MS products, emphasis on Excel</li><li>Python and SQL proficiency is highly preferred</li><li>Power BI Service administration experience</li><li>API querying, JSON and R proficiency a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education And/or Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, data science, statistics, mathematics, economics or other quantitative field.</li><li>Four (4) or more years of relevant experience, preferably in a legal or professional services firm, or any combination of training, education, and experience that demonstrates the ability to perform the position's duties.</li></ul><p><br></p>The Firm will comply with any applicable city or state workplace mandates in effect in regards to Covid-19.<p><br></p><em>This position description is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of the job. The statements contained in the position description are not necessarily all-inclusive and additional duties and responsibilities may be assigned as determined by business needs.</em><p><br></p><em>This position description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.</em><p><br></p><em>Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.</em><p><br></p><strong>California Applicants: </strong>Please visit our Privacy Notice and Notice at Collection to learn about our information practices in the Job Application and Employment context.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>Troutman Pepper adheres to a policy of equal opportunity and will make all employment decisions, which include hiring, promotion, transfer, demotion, evaluation, compensation and separation, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, pregnancy, citizenship, disability, genetic information, marital or armed forces status and any other classification as protected by law.<p><br></p><strong><u>Hiring Salary Range</u></strong><p><br></p>$90,000.00 - $110,000.00<p><br></p>

title: Data Quality Analyst
description: <strong>About INTERACTIVE BROKERS!</strong><p><br></p><strong>This is Hybrid role (3 days in office /2 days remote)</strong><p><br></p>Interactive Brokers Group has been consistently at the forefront of trading innovation , starting with the invention of the first floor-based handheld computer in 1983. We pride ourselves on being primarily a technology company and challenging the status quo. We push boundaries to offer our clients the best trading platform with the most sophisticated features at the lowest cost. Software development is the lifeblood of our firm, and it shows in our stellar brokerage platform. Interactive Brokers is regularly recognized as a leader in the financial services industry .<p><br></p><strong><u>About Your Team</u></strong><p><br></p>Our Data Office team is looking for a Data Quality Analyst, the main purpose of this position is to assist the data organization in the build, execution and monitoring of data quality rules and data quality assessments. This position assists in the implementation of an enterprise data governance program<p><br></p><strong><u>What Will Be Your Responsibilities Within IBKR</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop control structures within a simple environment to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels.</li><li>Work with business partners to gather and understand application and reporting data requirements.</li><li>Have prior experience with industry standard data governance tooling for data quality.</li><li>Build and maintain content to support data quality and governance tooling across client and service data sources as well as ongoing regulatory and compliance controls while managing compliance audits and processes.</li><li>Serve as a resource to the rest of the organization around SLAs and data quality thresholds in an aim to unify and educate teams across the organization about data quality standards and best practices.</li><li>Contribute to the overall business risk profile working with stakeholders to reduce risk and exposure in an agile, collaborative, and well socialized manner.</li><li>Draft and drive the implementation of data lifecycle management procedures for Data Quality Assessments for design, coding, testing and deployment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What Required Skill’s You Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree required in information science, data science, data management, computer science or related field preferred.</li><li>5+ years in data management and data governance, including working with data quality rules and in data analysis and data mapping.</li><li>2+ years of Python and/or SQL.</li><li>1+ years of Cloud experience (AWS preferred) related to risk and information security or related fields.</li><li>Strong analytical and technical skills to troubleshoot issues, analyze the cause, quickly come-up with the possible solution(s), document the changes, and communicate the change to the organization</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To be successful in this position, you will have the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Self-motivated and able to handle tasks with minimal supervision.</li><li>Superb analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Excellent collaboration and communication (Verbal and written) skills.</li><li>Outstanding organizational and time management skills.</li></ul><p><br></p>This role's anticipated base salary range is $130,000 to $150,000 annually based on skill's and experience. The offered salary is just part of the total compensation package. In addition to a competitive salary, the company offers both a discretionary cash bonus and stock award as well as a wide range of benefits, including health care, tuition reimbursement and much more<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Benefits &amp; Perks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary, annual performance-based bonus and stock grant</li><li>Retirement plan 401(k) with competitive company match</li><li>Excellent health and welfare benefits, including medical, dental, and vision benefits</li><li>Wellness screenings and assessments, health coaches and counseling services through an Employee Assistance Program (EAP)</li><li>Paid time off and a generous parental leave policy</li><li>Daily company lunch allowance provided and a fully stocked kitchen with healthy options for breakfast and snack</li><li>Corporate events including team outings, dinners, volunteer activities and company sports teams</li><li>Education reimbursement and learning opportunities</li><li>Modern offices with multi-monitor setups</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Company Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>Interactive Brokers LLC, a subsidiary of Interactive Brokers Group, Inc. (Ticker: IBKR) is a direct access electronic broker serving professionals, frequent traders, institutional investors, financial advisors and introducing brokers. Our clients have access to more than 150 market centers around the world from a single integrated account. Our employees are part of a dynamic, multi-national, fast-paced, results-oriented team that has spent four decades focused on advanced technology and automation that equips our clients with a uniquely sophisticated platform to manage their investment portfolios. We provide our clients with advantageous execution prices, risk and portfolio management tools, research facilities and investment products, at low or no cost, positioning them to achieve superior returns.<p><br></p>Headquartered in Greenwich, CT, USA. IBKR has offices in more than 15 countries across the world.<p><br></p>IBKR is a member of NYSE, FINRA, and SIPC. Interactive Brokers Group brokerage affiliates are regulated by securities and commodities agencies around the world.<p><br></p>Click the link to view a short video with a few words from current Interactive Brokers employees: https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=31899

Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><strong>As part of our </strong><strong>Enterprise Data Management team</strong><strong>, you’ll:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop data-driven solutions with current and next generation technologies to meet evolving business needs. </li><li>Provide technical design and develop Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) applications that interface with all key Discover applications. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and develop data-ingestion frameworks, real-time processing solutions, and data processing and transformation frameworks.  </li><li>Deploy and provide support for application codes and analytical models. </li><li>Provide senior-level technical consulting to peer data engineers during design and development for highly complex and critical data projects. </li><li>Create and enhance data solutions that enable seamless integration and flow of data across the data ecosystem.  </li><li>Provide business analysis and develop ETL code and scripting to meet all technical specifications and business requirements according to the established designs.  </li><li>Develop real-time data ingestion and stream-analytic solutions leveraging technologies such as Kafka, Apache Spark, Python and AWS-based solutions.  </li><li>Work extensively within the Cloud ecosystem and migrate data from Teradata to AWS-based platform.  </li><li>Utilize multiple development languages/tools such as Python, SPARK, Hive, Java to build prototypes and evaluate results for effectiveness and feasibility.  </li><li>Develop application systems that comply with the standard system development methodology and concepts for design, programming, backup, and recovery to deliver solutions that have superior performance and integrity.   </li><li>Contribute to determining programming approach, tools, and techniques that best meet the business requirements.  </li><li>Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, preparation of specifications and plans for the development of data processes.  </li><li>Offer system support as part of a support rotation with other team members.  </li><li>Operationalize open source data-analytic tools for enterprise use.  </li><li>Ensure data governance policies are followed by implementing or validating data lineage, quality checks, and data classification.  </li><li>Understand and follow the company development lifecycle to develop, deploy and deliver the solutions.    </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications You’ll Need</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Basics:</strong><strong> </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field  </li><li>4+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li><li>Knowledge and experience using query languages (SQL, Cypher) for relational and graph databases  </li><li>Willingness to continuously learn &amp; share learnings with others  </li><li>Capability to collaborate with stakeholders and project leaders to understand requirements, deliverables, and set expectations on tasks that you will be responsible for </li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment </li><li>Experience working in an agile and collaborative team environment  </li><li>Design and develop AtScale models based on data modeling of business requirements and entities </li><li>Great understanding of OLAP and dimensional modeling</li><li>Working knowledge in building multi-dimensional cubes, creating dimensions, facts, measures etc</li><li>Proficient in MDX and DAX</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following OLAP tools Microsoft SSAS, MicroStrategy, IBM Cognos etc</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following BI tools Tableau, PowerBI etc</li><li>Experience in solution delivery roles for business intelligence and data analytics</li><li>Experience in working with cloud databases and architectures such as Snowflake, AWS or Azure is a nice to </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>Security breaches are the number one cause of death amongst digital currency companies. Security is core to our mission and has been a key competitive differentiator for us as we scale.<p><br></p>As an Application Security Engineer on the Secure Design team, you will work closely with engineers, product managers and senior leadership on designing secure products from the ground up. You will be responsible for performing secure design reviews, threat modeling, vendor reviews, secure code reviews, vulnerability analysis and incident support. You’ll also have an opportunity to pitch, lead and participate in cross-functional initiatives that uplevel the security of all Coinbase products and services.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform design reviews, threat modeling and code reviews of upcoming features and products</li><li>Identify top product risk areas and lead risk-reduction initiatives with cross-functional teams</li><li>Improve and/or automate existing processes to increase efficiency</li><li>Participate in the team on-call rotation to support engineering teams through timely design consultations, vulnerability analysis, fix verification, etc</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in design review and/or threat modeling</li><li>Expertise in Web Security and Mobile Security</li><li>Experience in Cloud Security and Network Security</li><li>Strong communication skills with the ability to translate technical security requirements and risks into terms that anyone can understand</li><li>Ability to work independently and unblock yourself</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>MS or PhD in Computer Science or related field</li><li>Experience in at least one of: Java, Go, Ruby or Python</li><li>Experience designing, implementing and deploying production-level services</li><li>Experience automating manual processes</li><li>Experience in Blockchain Security</li></ul><p><br></p>Position ID: P22354<p><br></p><strong>Pay Transparency Notice:</strong> Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Range</u></strong><p><br></p>$140,250—$165,000 USD<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Know Your Rights notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.<p><br></p>Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).<p><br></p>Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants<p><br></p>Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. For US applicants only, by submitting your application you are agreeing to arbitration of disputes as outlined here.

description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>About the ELCA </strong><p><br></p>The Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA) is one of the largest Christian denominations in the United States, with nearly 3.3 million members in more than 8,900 worshiping communities across the 50 states, Caribbean, and U.S. Virgin Islands. With a vision to live in a world experiencing the difference God’s grace and love in Christ makes for all people and creation, the ELCA strives to be a welcoming, thriving, and connected church that introduces people to Jesus so they can discover community, justice, and love.<p><br></p>The Lutheran Center (national office) is located in Chicago, Illinois. description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Research Analyst key responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python, R, or any other general-purpose programming language (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-ResearchAnalys.002<p><br></p>
